trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnecting"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnecting"></xref> events.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnecting> event is raised by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.OnWebPartsConnecting%2A> method, and it indicates that the connection process has begun (for example, a user has selected a control and clicked a connect verb), but is not yet completed.
The event provides an opportunity to cancel a connection before it is complete.
If the connection is successfully completed, this event is followed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnected> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnecting> event is raised by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.OnWebPartsDisconnecting%2A> method, and it indicates that a user has clicked a disconnect verb, or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.DisconnectWebParts%2A> method has otherwise been called.
The event provides an opportunity to cancel the process of ending a connection before it is complete.
If the connection is ended successfully, this event is followed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnected> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionsCancelEventArgs> class contains information about the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnecting> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnecting> events.
It provides access to the Web Parts controls that are being connected or disconnected.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionsCancelEventArgs"></xref> class without a specified connection.
The Web Parts control providing data in the connection.
The connection point for providing data.
The Web Parts control consuming data in the connection.
The connection point for consuming data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionsCancelEventArgs"></xref> class with the specified connection.
The Web Parts control providing data in the connection.
The connection point for providing data.
The Web Parts control consuming data in the connection.
The connection point for consuming data.

The Web Parts connection involved in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnecting"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnecting"></xref> event.
Gets the Web Parts connection involved in the event.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> involved in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnecting"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnecting"></xref> event.
Gets the Web Parts control acting as the consumer in the connection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> acting as the consumer in the connection.
Gets the connection point that consumes data in the Web Parts connection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConsumerConnectionPoint"></xref>.
Gets the Web Parts control acting as the provider in the connection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> acting as the provider in the connection.
Gets the connection point that provides data in the Web Parts connection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref>.
